item.title: The Last of Us Players Think Astro Bot Has Brought an End to One Iconic Debate
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Some gamers feel as if Astro Bot's Joel cameo has settled a classic The Last of Us debate, with Joel wielding a brick - suggesting it is the superior throwable.
  • While it is the better option statistically, players tend to have different preferences, with some choosing the bottle. Still, it seems Team Asobi prefers bricks, or at least views at as the more iconic of the two tools.

Astro Bot 's Joel cameo appears to settle an age-old debate in the eyes of some The Last of Us fans . Now that PlayStation has created a full-fledged video game around Astro, who is generally considered the gaming brand's new mascot, Astro Bot fans have another, larger batch of references to appreciate, one of which shows Team Asobi potentially taking a side in one of The Last of Us community's biggest conflicts.

One of the things players have been enjoying the most about Astro Bot is the way that the game highlights minute details of beloved video game characters. Astro Bot achieves this through its numerous cameos, using stylized versions of the game's titular character to pay homage to other franchises. Some cameos are taken to the next level through props that can be acquired for the PlayStation-themed bots, with Joel wielding one of his two go-to throwable distraction tools. c

Astro Bot 's The Last of Us cameo displays Joel carrying a brick, which some Redditors have taken as a definitive answer to the debate over which item is better in the series' games. The many who have played through The Last of Us games tend to have a preference between bottles or bricks as they fight through the post-apocalyptic world, with everything from their look and sound to their durability being taken into consideration. Either can be used as a melee or throwing weapon, and while the brick is statistically better, the choice often comes down to what players vibe with. Still, it seems like Astro Bot is agreeing with the community's concensus on the superior throwable.

Astro Bot Settles The Last of Us' Brick vs. Bottle Debate

This makes sense, as there is an actual difference in bottles and bricks in The Last of Us games. Players have recognized that the brick is considerably more effective in melee combat, available for three hits, with some gamers nicknaming brick attacks as the "three-piece combo." In contrast, the bottle breaks after one hit during melee gameplay, though some Last of Us players have argued that it can stun enemies longer when it's thrown. Still, a majority of players prefer to use the brick because it feels like it would make more sense in survival combat. Additionally, the fact that Ellie is carrying a bow in her cameo can be considered a testament to its usefulness, in addition to how much it fits her character, so the same would make sense for the brick.

Astro Bot goes out of its way to offer entertaining cameos. So far, it's pleased many fans, Last of Us fans included. The Last of Us did not get a Hero Stage, but if Astro Bot eventually adds more content through some DLC or a sequel, then perhaps it will get even more love from Team Asobi.

item.title: Space Marine 2: How To Land Gun Strikes
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Perform Gun Strikes In Space Marine 2
  • Which Class Is Best For Gun Strikes In Space Marine 2

Space Marine 2 has a heavy focus on dueling when fighting larger enemies. Dueling requires a focus on just a single enemy and will have the player dodging, parrying, and trying to break the enemy's block in order to get some melee hits in.

On top of the obvious options in combat, players can also land a Gun Strike, which sees your Space Marine pull out their pistol and take a quick shot at a weakened enemy. There is a method to weakening enemies and setting up Gun Strikes; here's how.

How To Perform Gun Strikes In Space Marine 2

A Gun Strike happens whenever a red reticle appears on a staggered enemy and the player presses the fire button . No matter what weapon is currently equipped, the Space Marine will pull out their pistol and take a quick shot hitting the enemy in the head to deal a lot of damage and also restore one bar of armor for the player.

Players will also need to be facing the general direction of the reticle before pressing the fire button to trigger the Gun Strike animation and take the shot. The red reticle only appears on staggered enemies, and staggering them doesn't happen normally. There are two methods for getting an enemy to stagger:

  • Landing a perfect parry.
  • Landing a heavy attack.

Neither of these methods is a guarantee, and there's only ever a chance the enemy will stagger and the reticle will appear. That being said, landing heavy attacks to break an enemy's block is the best method to try and cause the enemy to stagger, as it is controllable by the player. Every melee weapon has a heavy attack that can be seen by opening up the menu when the weapon is equipped. The combo that breaks the block and is considered a heavy attack is represented by the cracked shield icon.

The pistol you have equipped does not determine the damage, as all Gun Strikes deal high damage on an enemy.

Which Class Is Best For Gun Strikes In Space Marine 2

Ultimately all classes are able to Gun Strike as they all have a secondary weapon. The most reliable method to staggering an enemy is by hitting them with a heavy attack, meaning you'll want to hit multiple enemies at once to increase your odds of at least staggering one. With that, the best classes for focusing solely on Gun Strikes are Assault and Bulwark , as they both focus most on melee weapons and keep and ranged weapon as a backup.

item.title: How To Get Mount & Emotes In Anime Vanguards
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Unlock Mounts & Emotes In Anime Vanguards
  • How To Equip Mounts & Emotes In Anime Vanguards

Besides being a nicely-made Tower Defense experience, Anime Vanguards has many different features, which include mounts and emotes. The first ones will allow you to move much faster around the battlefield and in the lobby. As for the emotes, they are cosmetic options that diversify the gameplay.

Even though these features seem different, they can be obtained for the same activity in this fun Roblox experience. But, it is worth noting that this will take quite a lot of time â€” especially if you have just started your adventure.

How To Unlock Mounts & Emotes In Anime Vanguards

By defending stages, summoning heroes, and completing other challenges in Anime Vanguards , players can earn dozens of different rewards. However, some activities can offer much more valuable rewards than others. For example, by completing Achievements , you can unlock mounts and emotes in Anime Vanguards .

Each biome has several Achievements that can only be completed by clearing each stage. Moreover, you will have to do this on Nightmare difficulty , so be prepared to use your strongest units.

For each Achievement completed, you will receive rewards such as Gems or Trait Rerolls . However, the most valuable goodies, including mounts and emotes, can only be obtained by completing all the achievements of the current biome . Here are the rewards that await you:

  • Trouble on Planet Namak : Cloud Mount, 5 Trait Reroll, 1K Gems, and Casey Emotes
  • Raid on Sand Village : Frog Mount, 5 Trait Reroll, 1K Gems, and Ric Flair Emotes
  • Disaster in the Double Dungeon : Mount, 5 Trait Reroll, 1K Gems, and Popular Vibe Emotes
  • The Collector : 2K Gems, 5 Trait Reroll, 10K Coins, and Jabba Switchaway Emotes
  • Pagargon Conqueror - Namak (I) : 900 Gems, 18 Trait Reroll, Pagargon Conqueror - Planet Namak ABX, and Tidy Emotes
  • Pagargon Conqueror - Sand Village (I) : 900 Gems, 18 Trait Reroll, Pagargon Conqueror - Sand Village ABX, and Griddy Emotes
  • Pagargon Conqueror - Double Dungeon (I) : 900 Gems, 18 Trait Reroll, Pagargon Conqueror - Double Dungeon ABX, and Boogie Down Emotes

How To Equip Mounts & Emotes In Anime Vanguards

Once you finally get your mount in Anime Vanguards , you'll want to ride it. To do this, open your inventory by clicking on the Items button. Then, go to the Mounts tab and select your new transport.

As for emotes, you only need to visit the Emotes NPC in the center of the lobby . Interact with her to equip up to four unlocked emotes and use them during battles.

item.title: Dead By Daylight: 18 Fun Survivor Builds
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Dead by Daylight offers endless gameplay possibilities with a wide array of Survivor perks for fun and unique trials.
  • Players can create interesting perk combinations tailored to their playstyle, refreshing even seasoned Survivors' experiences.
  • Experimenting with different Survivor builds can provide challenging gameplay, strategic advantages, and entertaining moments in The Fog.

Dead by Daylight offers the potential for infinitely diverse gameplay thanks to a catalog of over 100 Survivor perks. The interplay between the vast number of perks in Dead by Daylight provides the potential for fun and unique trials for both solo players and Survivors with friends.

Outside the meta Survivor gameplay, players can experiment with different builds that may not guarantee escape but will promise a good time. Whether it's endlessly evading hooks, confusing Killers, or staying stealthy, there are interesting perk combinations Dead by Daylight players can tailor around a specific play style, refreshing even seasoned Survivors' time in The Fog.

Updated September 14, 2024 by Mara Cowley: Dead by Daylight continues to enjoy its popularity thanks to its success in continually snapping up popular IPs, with its most recent being Dungeons and Dragons , Tomb Raider , and Castlevania , with more to surely be released in the not too distant future.

With all the overwhelming amount of characters and perks on offer, choosing what build to run can be tough. For those who are looking for the most fun DbD survivor builds , look no further! This article provides multiple fun DbD builds to run to further personal enjoyment of the game, breaking down what each perk does, and what the build aims to do.

1 The Quick & Stealthy Vault Build

Make Quick Escapes to Survive Chases

With the help of these perks, players can vault quickly, gain a burst of speed, and even hoodwink the Killers as they leave no evidence of their vault behind.

  • Finesse (Lara Croft): If the player is healthy, they vault with +20% to their Vaulting speed.
  • Quick and Quiet (Meg Thomas): Loud noise notifications from rushing windows, pallets, or lockers are all suppressed.
  • Dance with Me (Kate Denson): After rushing a vault or locker, scratch marks are suppressed for 3 seconds.
  • Lithe (Feng Min): Grants 50% Haste for 3 seconds after vaulting a window or pallet.

2 The Hero Build

Save Other Survivors From Perishing on Hook

Teamwork is the best hope for Survivors to make their escape, so it is always a good idea to unhook fellow Survivors. This build revolves around this act of altruism, giving benefits to reduce the chances of the Survivor being tunneled.

  • We'll Make It (General Perk): The player heals others with an additional 100% to their healing speed for up to 90 seconds.
  • Borrowed Time (Bill Overbeck): Extends Endurance of the Survivor unhooked for up to 10 seconds, and grants them haste for 10 seconds.
  • Babysitter (Steve Harrington): After unhooking another Survivor, the player sees the Killer's aura for 8 seconds. The Survivor who was unhooked doesn't leave blood pools or scratch marks and gains haste for up to 30 seconds.
  • Kindred (General Perk): Whenever the Killer is within 16 meters of a hooked Survivor, the Killer's aura is revealed to the player.

3 No Mither Build

Survivors Can Use This Build To Play DbD On Hard Mode

This build capitalizes on the game's notoriously worst and most absurd perk, No Mither. Escaping a trial with this setup is the ultimate challenge for players seeking to test their skills.

  • No Mither (David King): The player's pools of blood and grunts of pain are drastically reduced, their recovery speed is increased by 25%, and they can fully recover from the dying state. However, the Survivor is permanently injured and cannot heal, making them constantly one-hit.
  • Decisive Strike (Laurie Strode): Decisive Strikes activate for 60 seconds after being unhooked; if the Killer picks the player up in this time, they can escape their grasp by passing a skill check.
  • Object Of Obsession (Laurie Strode): Anytime the Killer reads their player's aura, the player also sees the Killer's. This perk makes the Survivor a huge target for a chase, as their aura is revealed to the Killer every 30 seconds for 3 seconds. The player's repairing, healing, and cleansing speeds increase by 6%.
  • Lithe (Feng Min): After performing a rushed vault action, the player receives a 50% Haste buff.

4 Gen Rush Build

Players Can Speedrun The Trial With This Build

There are many generator perks and, therefore, plenty of generator-dedicated builds, but this one stands out as the most fun. It works best when used as a co-op build, and players can also bring in a toolbox to finish the generators at record speed.

  • Invocation: Weaving Spiders (Sable Ward): This perk allows the player to perform an Invocation in the basement for 60 seconds, revealing their aura to all Survivors and speeding up the process if others join. Upon completion, all generators require ten fewer repair charges, but the player will become injured and suffer the Broken status effect for the rest of the trial.
  • Resilience (General Perk): This perk pairs well with Invocation because when the player is injured, their repairing, healing, and other action speeds increase by 9%.
  • DÃ©jÃ  Vu (General Perk): The auras of the three generators closest to each other are revealed to the player, and their repair speed on those generators is increased by 6%.
  • This Is Not Happening (General Perk): Increases the success zone of great skill checks by 30% when injured.

5 The Luck Build

Players Must Rely On RNG To Survive

This build adds hilarious unpredictability to trials, with perks that maximize randomness, resulting in either incredible luck or great misfortune. Players can also use Offerings to boost their chances of success.

  • Dramaturgy (Nicolas Cage): When Healthy, players can activate Dramaturgy to be granted a 0.5-second burst of +25% Haste followed by one of four randomized effects: become Exposed for 12 seconds, gain an extended 2-second Haste, scream, or acquire a random Rare Item with Add-ons.
  • Bardic Inspiration (Aestri Yazar): When standing still, the player can enter a unique animation where they play the lute for 15 seconds, empowering nearby Survivors for 90 seconds with an effect dependent on the outcome of a rolled dice. The effects range from the player screaming to boosting skill check progress by up to 3%.
  • Slippery Meat (General Perk): Increases the player's odds of successfully unhooking themselves by 4% (on top of the base 4%) and adds to their number of available hook escape attempts by +3.
  • Up The Ante (Ace Visconti): Boosts all players' odds of successfully self-unhooking by 3% for every Survivor still in the trial, stackable up to a maximum of 9%. This perk combines well with Slippery Meat, granting the player a 17% chance of unhooking themselves.

6 The Deception Build

Survivors Can Outsmart Killers With These Mind Game Perks

This build empowers Survivors to shift the balance against the Killer with skillfully employed mind games. Using these perks, players can trick and misdirect the Killer, creating openings for strategic and satisfying plays.

  • Mirrored Illusion (Aestri Yazar): After repairing a generator by 50%, Mirrored Illusion activates, allowing the player to produce a clone of themselves for 120 seconds on a generator, chest, exit gate, or totem.
  • Diversion (Adam Francis): Players can distract the Killer by throwing a pebble that creates a loud sound and fake scratch marks in that direction.
  • Red Herring (Zarina Kassir): After repairing a generator for 3 seconds, Survivors can misdirect the Killer by entering a locker and triggering a missed-skill check notification at the generator's location.
  • Deception (Ã‰lodie Rakoto): Players can confound Killers by fake entering lockers, after which they leave no scratch marks or pools of blood for 3 seconds.

7 The Trap Build

Survivors Can Turn The Tables On The Killer With These Trap Perks

This build enables Survivors to strategically entrap the Killer, turning pallets and generators into deadly weapons in their arsenal.

  • Wiretap (Ada Wong): After repairing generators by 50%, Wiretap activates, allowing the player to install a trap on a partially progressed generator that will reveal the Killer's aura to all Survivors within 14 meters.
  • Chemical Trap (Ellen Ripley): After repairing generators by 50%, Chemical Trap activates and can be installed on a dropped pallet. When the Killer breaks it, the Trap explodes and slows them by 50% for 4 seconds.
  • Any Means Necessary (Yui Kimura): This perk complements Chemical Trap by allowing the player to reset a dropped palette so Survivors can re-use it. The player can also see the aura of all dropped but not broken palettes.
  • Blast Mine (Jill Valentine): After repairing a generator by 50%, the player can install a trap on a partially progressed generator. When the Killer damages it, the Mine explodes, stunning them and blinding nearby survivors.

8 The Anti-Slugging Build

Downed Survivors Can Escape Capture With This Build

While there is an unwritten rule in Dead by Daylight that "slugging" is considered bad manners since it creates boring gameplay for downed players, this build makes it advantageous for Survivors and allows for some hilarious close-call self-saves.

  • Unbreakable (Bill Overbeck): Players can recover from the dying state once per trial, and their recovery speed is increased by 35%.
  • Tenacity (David Tapp): Players can crawl while recovering and are 50% faster when doing so. Survivors' grunts of pain are also decreased by 75% for stealthy escapes.
  • Soul Guard (Cheryl Mason): After recovering, players gain the Endurance status effect (temporary invincibility) for 8 seconds. If Cursed by a Hex, they can recover infinitely during the trial.
  • Boon: Exponential (Jonah Vasquez): All Survivors can self-recover from the dying state while in the aura of the Boon Totem, which also speeds up recovery by 100%.

9 The Invisible Build

Survivors Can Vanish From Sight With This Stealth Build

If combined with careful movement and awareness, the following build can help Survivors slip through trials undetected or disappear mid-chase. Players can maximize their stealthiness by playing as one of the quietest Survivors.

  • Light-Footed (Ellen Ripley): When healthy, the player's running sounds are suppressed. It has a 20-second cooldown after the player performs a rushed vault action.
  • Lucky Break (Yui Kimura): When injured, the Survivor leaves no scratch marks or pools of blood for 60 seconds.
  • Distortion (Jeff Johansen): The Survivor's aura is concealed whenever the Killer attempts to read it, and their scratch marks are suppressed for 10 seconds.
  • Lightweight (General Perk): The player's scratch marks are more difficult for the Killer to track and fade faster.

10 The Self-Save Build

Solo Survivors Can Rescue Themselves With These Perks

Perfect for solo Survivors, or the lone wolf player, this following build employs one of the best Survivor perks, Decisive Strike, to empower players to be the masters of their fate.

  • Deliverance (Adam Francis): The player can successfully unhook themselves, provided they have previously safely unhooked someone else.
  • Plot Twist (Nicolas Cage): When Injured, the player can silently enter the Dying State. Plot Twist suppresses grunts and bleeding and allows for full recovery from the Dying State. After self-recovery, the player is instantly healed and gains a 50% haste effect.
  • Decisive Strike (Laurie Strode): If the Survivor is picked up within 60 seconds after being unhooked or unhooking themselves, they have the power to stun the Killer and break free from their hold by passing a skill check.
  • Power Struggle (Ã‰lodie Rakoto): Carried Survivors can drop a pallet to stun the Killer and escape their grasp.

11 The Locker Build

Players Can Use Lockers To Evade And Toy With The Killer

The following build transforms lockers into secret weapons for Survivors, capable of stunning Killers and shielding Survivors, making for an easy game of cat and mouse.

  • Head On (Jane Romero): Players can stun the Killer by quickly exiting a locker.
  • Quick & Quiet (Meg Thomas): This perk synergizes with Head On by allowing players to sprint silently into lockers.
  • Flashbang (Leon Scott Kennedy): While in a locker, Survivors can craft flash grenades, which can blind and distract the Killer.
  • Inner Strength (Nancy Wheeler): After cleansing a totem, Survivors can heal one health state by entering a locker.

12 The Speed Build

Survivors Can Outrun Danger With These Speedy Perks

Survivors can escape from even the deadliest of Killers with this build, which provides an incredible combined speed boost so players can outpace their violent attackers.

  • Boon: Dark Theory (Yoichi Asakawa): All Survivors within range of the Boon Totem gain a 2% speed boost.
  • Sprint Burst (Meg Thomas): Unless they are Exhausted, any time the player runs, they sprint 150% faster for 3 seconds.
  • Fixated (Nancy Wheeler): The player walks 20% faster and can see their scratch marks. The increased walking speed allows players to use Sprint Burst less, saving it for when necessary.
  • Hope (General Perk): When the exit gates are powered, the player gains a 7% speed increase.

13 The Selfless Medic Build

Survivors With Friends Can Put Their Team First With This Altruistic Build

The following build requires players to make bold rescues and risk their own lives for their fellow Survivors, the true build of a selfless and heroic player.

  • For the People (Zarina Kassir): A healthy player can instantly trade one health state with another Survivor.
  • Made For This (Gabriel Soma): This perk works in tandem with For the People by providing the player with a 10-second Endurance status effect upon healing a teammate.
  • We're Gonna Live Forever (David King): Increases the player's healing speed on a dying Survivor by 100%. Provided they have already saved a Survivor, the player also grants a 10-second Endurance status effect to Survivors they recover.
  • Buckle Up (Ashley J. Williams): This perk gives a 5-second 50% Haste benefit to any Survivors the player heals and suppresses their scratch marks. Both players also see the Killer's aura for 10 seconds.

14 The Sabotage Build

Survivors Can Disrupt The Killer's Plans With This Sabotage Build

Through daring rescues and strategic sabotage, these perks allow players to foil the Killer's attempts at hooking fellow Survivors. Survivors can bring useful items, such as flashlights or toolboxes, for additional sabotaging opportunities.

  • Empathy (Claudette Morel): The auras of injured and downed Survivors are revealed to the player within a certain range, setting up potential rescues.
  • Breakout (Yui Kimura): When the player is within 6 meters of a carried Survivor, they gain a 7% Haste effect, and the held Survivor's wiggle speed is increased by 20%.
  • Saboteur (Jake Park): Players can sabotage hooks without a Toolbox and can see the auras of all hooks within a certain range.
  • Champion of Light (Alan Wake): While shining a flashlight, Champion of Light provides the survivor with 50% Haste, and successfully blinding the Killer results in them suffering a 20% Hindered status effect for 6 seconds.

15 The Aura-Reading Build

These "Wall Hack" Perks Give Survivors Maximum Information On The Killer

This aura-reading build provides Survivors with unparalleled awareness during trials, taking the guesswork out of looping and ensuring they are always one step ahead of the Killer.

  • Dark Sense (General Perk): When a generator is completed, Dark Sense is activated, revealing the Killer's aura for 10 seconds if they come within 24 meters of the Survivor.
  • Object of Obsession (Laurie Strode): Each time the player's aura is revealed to the Killer, the Survivor also sees the Killer's aura. The player is 100% more likely to be the Obsession, and if they are, the Killer sees their aura for 3 seconds every 30 seconds.
  • Scene Partner (Nicolas Cage): When in the Killer's terror radius, Scene Partner makes the player scream, which reveals the Killer's aura for 5 seconds. There is a 50% chance of the player screaming again, extending the reveal by 2 seconds.
  • Alert (Feng Min): Whenever the Killer breaks a pallet or damages a generator, their aura is revealed to the player.

16 Extended Aura Reading Build

Read Auras Across Distances

Aura-reading is a useful tool in the arsenal for both Killers and Survivors. It allows them to see what the other is doing for tracking and avoiding, but a lot of perks have a distance limit, which is where open-handed comes in.

  • Dark Sense (General Perk): When a generator is completed, Dark Sense is activated, revealing the Killer's aura for 10 seconds if they come within 24 meters of the Survivor.
  • Open-Handed (Ace Visconti): Increases the radius of all Aura-reading abilities emanating from Survivors for up to 16 meters.
  • Babysitter (Steve Harrington): After unhooking another Survivor, the player sees the Killer's aura for 8 seconds. The Survivor who was unhooked doesn't leave blood pools or scratch marks and gains haste for up to 30 seconds.
  • Kindred (General Perk): Whenever the Killer is within 16 meters of a hooked Survivor, the Killer's aura is revealed to the player.

17 The Wiggle Build

Players Can Escape The Grasp Of The Killer With These Wiggle Perks

The wiggle build boosts Survivors' chances of escaping the Killer's clutches while being carried, making it great for Survivors who regularly risk Killer detection, wrath, and attention.

  • Boil Over (Kate Denson): Increases the swaying effects of wiggling on the Killer and obscures hook auras within a certain distance. When the Killer falls from a great height, it also accelerates the player's wiggle progression by 33%. Players can equip an Offering for one of the best maps for Survivors to maximize the perk's potential.
  • Flip Flop (Ash Williams): 50% of a player's recovery progression is transformed into wiggle progression.
  • Unbreakable (Bill Overbeck): This perk compliments Flip Flop by improving recovery speed, which is subsequently turned into wiggle progression.
  • Power Struggle (Ã‰lodie Rakoto): Carried Survivors can use a pallet to stun the Killer. It requires a 15% wiggle advancement to activate, which the perks listed above will assist in achieving.

18 The Chase Build

Players Can Endlessly Loop Killers With This Fun Chase Build

This build unlocks the potential of Nicolas Cage's Dramaturgy, hailed as the most fun perk among players, harnessing its chaotic nature and allowing players to embrace the thrill of the chase.

  • Dramaturgy (Nicolas Cage): When Healthy, players can activate Dramaturgy to be granted a 0.5-second burst of +25% Haste followed by one of four randomized effects: become Exposed for 12 seconds, gain an extended 2-second Haste, scream, or acquire a random Rare Item with Add-ons. Dramaturgy causes the players to become Exhausted.
  • Calm Spirit (Jake Park): Counters the adverse effects of Dramaturgy by suppressing the player's urge to scream and other audible alerts.
  • Vigil (Quentin Smith): Reduces the cooldown duration of Exhausted and other negative status effects, including Exposed, for both the player and nearby teammates so that players can get the most value out of Dramaturgy.
  • Windows of Opportunity (Kate Denson): Grants players the ability to see the auras of all breakable walls, pallets, and windows within a 32-meter range, aiding in strategic decision-making during chases.

item.title: Talented Minecraft Fan Recreates Movie Trailer Using In-Game Footage and Mods
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A Minecraft fan has recreated the movie trailer in-game with mods and a texture pack, replacing film characters with in-game skins.
  • The in-game trailer mirrors key elements of the original trailer, and the work the player did is seriously impressive.

A talented Minecraft fan has recreated the movie trailer using in-game footage with a texture pack and mods. The Minecraft movie has been widely criticized for its combination of animation and live-action, and this in-game trailer may be what some of the community was hoping for.

Since it was released, Minecraft has garnered significant attention, generating $365 million in revenue in 2022 alone. While fans may not have been calling for it in its early days, some gamers have hoped for a Minecraft movie. Warner Bros. Pictures took on that challenge, casting Jack Black as the game's protagonist, Steve. Ahead of the movie trailer's release, some leaks hinted at props and characters used in its creation. When the trailer was released, it received a mixed response, largely due to its humor and Jack Black not resembling Steve. Despite this, other fans have defended the movie, insisting that its target demographic is children. One gamer who seemingly appreciated the trailer has recreated it in-game, and their work is impressive.

Reddit user NEW-Mattiou recently shared their own version of the Minecraft movie trailer created with in-game assets. Like the movie teaser, this trailer begins by zooming in on a rectangular green portal before panning backward in a familiar Minecraft Seed. The characters represented by Jason Momoa, Emma Myers, and Danielle Brooks are replaced by in-game skins that resemble them. Each of them curiously looks around the blocky setting as they do in the trailer before it cuts to focusing on an in-game Sheep rather than the nightmare fuel from the movie. A montage then ensues, showing Piglins flying through the sky, a wolf howling at the moon, and a sneaky Creeper just as the movie teaser does.

This Minecraft Fan Made an In-Game Movie Trailer

The in-game trailer shows Minecraft Steve appearing in front of the main cast in a puff of smoke rather than fire. Like in the movie trailer, Jason Momoa's character holds a glowing blue cube, the origin of which is currently unknown. Blocky letters soon begin to form in the sky, spelling out Minecraft as they do in the tutorial world, with text underneath cleverly calling it "Movie Edition" in place of Java or Bedrock edition. The in-game trailer concludes with Piglins running past a llama which is notably less emotive than the movie one. This trailer was created using BBS Mod, Fabric, and Fabric API which enable players to create animations. Many of the scenes appear to reflect the Minecraft Cartoon Texture Pack, but the Sheep is notably from the base version of the game.

As the Minecraft community has many dedicated members, the full movie may one day get the same treatment that NEW-Mattiou gave the teaser. With Mojang continuing to update Minecraft , some biomes, items, or mobs may be in the full movie that aren't in the game yet.
